title: How to Delete All Files from a Rewritable CD

steps.title: Insert the CD into your computer.
steps.content: Insert the CD into your computer. It should go into your computer's disc tray label side-up.

steps.title: Open File Explorer .
steps.content: Open File Explorer . Click the folder-shaped icon in the lower-left side of the Start menu, or press Windows key + E .

steps.title: Click This PC.
steps.content: Click This PC . This computer-shaped option is on the left side of the File Explorer window, though you may have to scroll up or down in the left-hand sidebar to see it.

steps.title: Select the CD drive.
steps.content: Select the CD drive. Click the CD drive icon, which looks like a grey hard drive with a CD behind it.

steps.title: Click the Manage tab.
steps.content: Click the Manage tab. It's in the upper-left side of the window. A toolbar will appear below it.

steps.title: Click Erase this disc.
steps.content: Click Erase this disc . This option is in the "Media" section of the Manage toolbar. A window will appear.

steps.title: Click Next.
steps.content: Click Next . It's in the bottom-right corner of the window. Doing so will prompt your CD to begin erasing. You can track the erasing progress by watching the bar in the middle of the window.

steps.title: Click Finish when prompted.
steps.content: Click Finish when prompted. It's at the bottom of the window. Your CD has now been erased.

steps.title: Insert the CD into your Mac's external CD drive.
steps.content: Insert the CD into your Mac's external CD drive. Unless you have a pre-2012 Mac that has a built-in CD drive, you will need to use an external CD reader to erase your CD.

steps.title: Click Go.
steps.content: Click Go . It's a menu item in the upper-left side of your Mac's screen. A drop-down menu will appear. If you don't see Go in the menu bar, click Finder or the desktop first to make it appear.

steps.title: Click Utilities.
steps.content: Click Utilities . This option is near the bottom of the drop-down menu. Doing so opens a folder.

steps.title: Double-click Disk Utility.
steps.content: Double-click Disk Utility . You'll find this grey, hard drive-shaped app in the Utilities folder.

steps.title: Select your CD's name.
steps.content: Select your CD's name. Click the CD's name on the left side of the window under the "Devices" heading.

steps.title: Click the Erase tab.
steps.content: Click the Erase tab. It's at the top of the Disk Utility window. The CD's properties window will open.

steps.title: Click Completely.
steps.content: Click Completely . This option lets you completely erase the CD.

steps.title: Click Erase.
steps.content: Click Erase . Doing so begins erasing your CD. This may take several minutes depending on how large the CD is. Once the process is complete, you'll receive a pop-up that says "You have inserted a blank CD", signifying that the CD is erased.
